filesystem.comment: Limited filesystem access - only grant access to specific project directories

memory.comment: Optional: Ephemeral storage for conversation context

_comment_security: SECURITY WARNING: Never put API keys, tokens, or secrets in this configuration file!
_comment_secrets: Use environment variables for sensitive data instead of hardcoding them here
_comment_example_env_vars: For custom servers needing secrets, use: 'env': { 'API_KEY': '${API_KEY}' }
_comment_remote_integrations: For GitHub, Notion, Zapier, Supabase, etc., use Claude Desktop's Connectors UI instead of JSON config
_comment_connectors_ui: Open Claude Desktop → Settings → Connectors to set up remote integrations with proper OAuth flows
_comment_deny_lists: Always use deny lists to protect sensitive files like .env, credentials, SSH keys
_comment_least_privilege: Only grant MCPs the minimum access they need - restrict filesystem paths to specific directories
_comment_minimal_config: This is a minimal safe example - only add MCPs you actually need
_comment_path_variables: Use $HOME instead of hardcoded paths like /Users/username for portability
_comment_before_committing: Before committing this file to version control, ensure no secrets are present!
_comment_version_control: Consider adding claude_desktop_config.json to .gitignore if it contains environment-specific paths
